Module 2 – Virtual Server and Pools Status and Behavior¶

You are the administrator of a pair of BIG-IPs with a number of virtual servers pre-configured. In this lab you will determine how traffic is processed and take a look at various virtual server states and some reasons a virtual server may not be working.

201 Objectives orimarily covered in these labs are::
  • 4.01
    • Apply procedural concepts required to modify and manage virtual servers
  • 1.03
    • Identify the reason a virtual server is not working as expected
  • 4.02
    • Apply procedural concepts required to modify and manage pools
  • 1.04
    • Identify the reason a pool is not working as expected
  • 2.04
    • Identify the reason load balancing is not working as expected

Estimated completion time: 45 minutes

  • Virtual Server Status
    • Test Disabled Virtual Servers
    • Virtual Server Connection Limits and Status
  • Pool Member and Virtual Servers
    • Create a new monitor
    • Effects of Monitors on Members, Pools and Virtual Servers
    • More on status and member specific monitors
  • Load Balancing
    • Static Load Balancing
    • Priority Group Activation
    • Effects of Persistence on Load Balancing
